data.title: National Library of Colombia (Bogota)
data.meta_description: National Library of Colombia is a museum in Bogota. View visitor information, information about the collection and read reviews.
data.text:
The National Library of Colombia, located in Bogota, is a significant cultural institution under the Colombian Ministry of Culture. As a visitor, you can explore a wide range of collections and services offered by the library. It's not just a place for scholars and researchers, but also a fascinating destination for tourists interested in Colombian culture and history.

Historical Significance of the National Library of Colombia

The National Library of Colombia holds the distinction of being the oldest national library in the Americas, having been founded in 1777. This historical significance adds to the allure of the library for tourists, offering a glimpse into the rich literary and cultural heritage of the region.

The Extensive Collection of the National Library of Colombia

The National Library of Colombia boasts a vast collection exceeding 2,000,000 volumes. This includes 47 incunabula, 610 volumes of manuscripts, and a variety of other 'rare and curious' books. This extensive collection provides a unique opportunity for tourists to delve into the rich literary history of Colombia and the wider region.
